text: I'm Karthik Rao co-founder and CEO of
signal FX we are at our headquarters in
beautiful San Mateo California signal
effects is a cloud monitoring service
for operators of cloud native
applications what's different about
signal effects is we employ a streaming
analytics approach that allows us to be
much more proactive much more real-time
in monitoring today's applications
we're also purpose-built for today's
infrastructures so if you're leveraging
highly elastic container style
architectures we are uniquely
well-suited to help you monitor those
environments when we started signal
effects the initial focus was on
building a best-in-class
metrics analytics system and that is
very helpful for understanding what's
going on at each individual component
and what that helped you do is really
understand when you had a problem to be
a lot more proactive and identifying
problems particularly if there were
dependencies across different teams what
the micro-services APM product really
has enabled our customers to do is to
understand not just what's happening at
an individual component level but to
understand the flow of transactions as
they go through different micro services
and that is a much more complicated
problem to solve in the APM world for
micro services than it then it had been
in the more traditional world and so we
really focused on solving the problem
for today's environments and that's what
we did with micro services APM the
market has come a long long long ways in
the last six years and what we've seen
is you know the first phase is you know
your typical lift and shift and you know
people moving workloads and that's what
a lot of the enterprises have been
focused on the last several years but
what's exciting now is we're refining
all there's there's so much new
application development in this move
fast and break things model right
hopefully without breaking things but
the idea is it's lots of small teams
developing micro services releasing
software on a daily basis or weekly
basis leveraging these highly elastic
environments and so we have always
focused on where the puck was going in
these cloud native organizations and
it's really great to see the market
embracing that in a meaningful way and
we we feel it's really hit an inflection
point in the past couple of years
I'd say observability as a term has
really gained a lot more prominence as
organizations have moved to
our DevOps style cultures where as the
development team you build it you own it
and you run it and in that kind of a
world people care about a lot more than
just as my system up or down because
they actually have the power to make the
software better and so you move beyond
just wanting to know when there's a
problem to how can I develop my code in
a more effective way to avoid these
problems and to do that really requires
a data-driven approach and so
observability is more about collecting
in proactively instrumenting data across
your entire application environment so
that you can really use a data-driven
approach to figure out how to make your
software better and when issues come up
to have all of the instrumentation so
you can understand exactly what caused
that in a more effective way at a high
level we're really excited about the
move to more automated systems right
everyone's moving to infrastructure as
code of the entire infrastructure stack
and even the application stack is now
the newer technologies and frameworks
whether it's service smash or frameworks
like kubernetes are enabling much more
robust capabilities around automating
actions and so that fits very well with
our vision of the future right where we
are collecting data across the entire
environment and you know we started with
the infrastructure world we've been
adding more and more application data
and we'll continue to extend the domains
in which we're collecting data and
really providing a best-in-class set of
analytics around it - as people move
towards automating more and more actions
having great signals in is critical to
creating great automation and actions on
the output side we're really excited
about the direction of the industry and
very very excited about the
contributions that we're going to be
making
